fields.headline: Del Bosque denies Ronaldo rebuke
fields.bodyText: Real Madrid coach, Vicente del Bosque, today denied having ever rebuked his Brazilian ace Ronaldo, after Real Madrid coach, Vincent del Bosque rebuked his Brazilian ace Ronaldo yesterday. "All the players at Real Madrid, with one exception are completely involved in working for the team," Del Bosque said at a book launch in Salamanca. "The only player who is different is Ronaldo." Del Bosque quickly sought to defuse the row, saying he had not intended to criticise Ronaldo, who is due to return from international duty with fellow Brazilians Roberto Carlos and Flavio Conceicao late on Thursday. "I wasn't criticising or censuring Ronaldo - absolutely not," Del Bosque said. "I'm sure I expressed myself badly. I speak in a lot of places and talking so much is dangerous. When I spoke yesterday I wasn't being accurate. "I wasn't criticising Ronaldo when I said he didn't get involved in defensive work for the team, I was just stating a fact. He gives us great attacking qualities and to give him defensive duties wouldn't suit his characteristics." "Zidane, Figo and Raul, to name the most famous players, all work hard for the team. They know that they shine when the team is playing well and winning titles."
